content.description: Sit start on horizontal rail and climb into the stand, just a few extra moves but makes the top more interesting

Begins at the hole about 7 ft off the ground.  Follows a series of left-trending pockets to an easy move to a crimp.  Then punch left to a flake at the lip and a hard move to a sloping crimp.  Punch left for a good crimp around the lip and then move right.  The left line of the two on the Eden Boulder's main face.

The Black Utah Bouldering book has this route improperly marked as Anatomy Act (V9).  In fact, Anatomy Act sds (V12) takes the far left arete when facing Save Yourself.
content.location: Begins at the hole about 7ft of the ground.  Downclimbs off the back by an old tree.  Variations.  Save Yourself sds is V8.  Save Yourself direct is V9 and takes the right hand crimp on Save Yourself with the left hand and then does a hard move to a shallow to finger pocket and the crux move to the lip.

content.description: Series of crimps and pockets lead to a hard move to a sloping left hand crimp and then another hard move to a right hand sidepull crimp incut.  Top out is rather manageable.  One of the top five V10's at Joe's.
content.location: Eden is the right line of on the main face of the Eden Boulder.  Begins sitting down on two crimps and a left heel hook.

content.description:
A nice arete, with interesting moves, and cool holds. This is the arete to the right of Save Yourself.

Start with with both hands on holds on the arete at about chest to head hight. Pull on and make a big move to a pocket on the right side of the arete with the right hand. Left hand to a sloper on the left side. Continue up to more slopers, and a mantle where the angle eases off.
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a spotter. The problem is not tall, but the landing slopes downwards.
content.location: This is the arete on the left side of the face of Save Yourself and Eden.
